Description for class Assignment

Variables

  • log_assignment_id – Primary key indexing for student_id

  • workspace_id – slackbot workspace- unique

  • assignment_name – name of the assignment- unique

  • due_by – to be submited by - date time

  • homework_url – url for the assignment

  • created_by – name of the creator of assignment

class api.models.Course(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Description for class Course

Variables

  • log_course_id – Primary key indexing for course

  • workspace_id – slackbot workspace id -unique

  • semester – Semester for which course is offered - unique

  • course_name – name of the course - unique

  • department – Department that offers this course

  • bot_token – token for internal communication with slackbot

  • admin_user_id – user id/role who can edit the course field

department¶

group_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

log_course_id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class api.models.CourseManager(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.manager.Manager

API’s for Class Course

To perform CRUD operations on Course.

create_course(workspace_id, course_name, department, semester, bot_token, admin_user_id)¶

Creates Course

Parameters

  • workspace_id (str) – slackbot related id , 1 for each course

  • course_name (str) – Name of the course

  • department (int) – Name of the department that the course belongs to

  • semester (str) – Semester in which the course is offered

  • bot_token (str) – Slackbot related token

  • admin_user_id (str) – user id of the admin

Returns

message for successful creation

Return type

str

objects = <api.models.GroupManager object>¶
registered_course¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

registered_course_id¶
student_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

group¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.
